item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, November 27, 2024 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Hacker in Snowflake extortions may be a U.S. soldier (138 points | 57 comments)
2. I Didn't Need Kubernetes, and You Probably Don't Either (86 points | 74 comments)
3. Launch HN: Human Layer (YC F24) – Human-in-the-Loop API for AI Systems (271 points | 167 comments)
4. Teen mathematicians tie knots through a mind-blowing fractal (200 points | 34 comments)
5. Executing ARM Jazelle (JVM Bytecode) on the Wii's Starlet (45 points | 6 comments)
6. Htmy – Async, pure-Python rendering engine (33 points | 6 comments)
7. A solution to The Onion problem of J. Kenji Lopez-Alt (2021) (295 points | 114 comments)
8. GenChess (170 points | 118 comments)
9. OpenAI hits pause on video model Sora after artists leak access in protest (23 points | 5 comments)
10. ZetaOffice: LibreOffice in the Browser (114 points | 30 comments)
11. LLVM-powered devirtualization (190 points | 6 comments)
12. Git-crypt – transparent file encryption in Git (58 points | 21 comments)
13. Show HN: SQLite Plugin for Jekyll (181 points | 56 comments)
14. The impact of the cosmological constant on past and future star formation (8 points | discuss)
15. D-Link says it won't patch 60k older modems (129 points | 80 comments)

17. Creating a social photo frame from scratch (17 points | 4 comments)

19. The Many Faces of the Kingdom of Shu (4 points | discuss)
20. Show HN: Silent Poems – Visual expression of unspoken thoughts (85 points | 22 comments)
21. FQL: A KV Query Language (27 points | 5 comments)
22. ISPs say their "excellent customer service" is why users don't switch providers (139 points | 88 comments)
23. Ask HN: Has anyone tried adapting a court reporter keyboard for writing code? (60 points | 57 comments)
24. Henry James and H.G. Wells (1958) (51 points | 30 comments)
25. Sombrero Galaxy dazzles in new James Webb image (51 points | 27 comments)
26. Imperfect Parfit (6 points | 2 comments)
27. Tesla excluded from EV buyer credits in California proposal (14 points | 13 comments)
28. Remembering Cyberia, the first ever cyber cafe (112 points | 63 comments)
29. The industry structure of LLM makers (120 points | 109 comments)
30. The AI reporter that took my old job just got fired (269 points | 315 comments)
